trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you enable push notifications using Azure Notification Hubs to the quickstart project.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification using Notification Hubs each time a record is inserted.

trans-unit.source: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.
trans-unit.target: The notification hub that you create is free with your mobile service, can be managed independent of the mobile service, and can be used by other applications and services.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This topic shows you how to manually configure push notifications using Windows Notification Service (WNS) for a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This topic shows you how to manually configure push notifications using Windows Notification Service (WNS) for a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: You can use Visual Studio 2013 tools to automatically configure the same push notifications in a Windows app project.
trans-unit.target: You can use Visual Studio 2013 tools to automatically configure the same push notifications in a Windows app project.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [universal Windows app version](mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started-push.md) of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [universal Windows app version](mobile-services-javascript-backend-windows-store-javascript-get-started-push.md) of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable push notifications:

trans-unit.source: Register your app with WNS and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app with WNS and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Update the app to register for notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the app to register for notifications

trans-unit.source: Update server scripts to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update server scripts to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Insert data to receive push notifications
trans-unit.target: Insert data to receive push notifications

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get started with data] to connect your project to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get started with data] to connect your project to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When a mobile service has not been connected, the Add Push Notification wizard creates this connection for you.
trans-unit.target: When a mobile service has not been connected, the Add Push Notification wizard creates this connection for you.

trans-unit.source: Register your app with WNS and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app with WNS and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with WNS and Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with WNS and Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update your Windows Store app to register for notifications.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update your Windows Store app to register for notifications.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to register for notifications
trans-unit.target: Update the app to register for notifications

trans-unit.source: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can receive push notifications, you must register a notification channel.

trans-unit.source: Open the file default.js and insert the following code after the code that creates the **MobileServiceClient** instance:
trans-unit.target: Open the file default.js and insert the following code after the code that creates the **MobileServiceClient** instance:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Press the **F5** key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **F5** key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A popup dialog with the registration key is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Open the Package.appxmanifest file and make sure that in the **Application UI** tab, **Toast capable** is set to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: Open the Package.appxmanifest file and make sure that in the **Application UI** tab, **Toast capable** is set to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can raise toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: Update server scripts to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: Update server scripts to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Store app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrated the basics of enabling a Windows Store app to use Mobile Services and Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Next, consider completing the next tutorial, [Send push notifications to authenticated users], which shows how to use tags to send push notifications from a Mobile Service to only an authenticated user.
